intro: Euphorbia mercurialis, commonly known as the mercury spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its succulent, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. The plant contains toxic compounds, including latex and alkaloids, which can cause skin irritation and other health issues. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. Due to its toxicity, it is important to handle the plant with care.
